definition: free reed wind instrument similar to the sheng 笙[sheng1], used in ancient China
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]
player of the yu 竽[yu2] (free reed wind instrument)

sentences.english: He would order 300 musicians at a time to play the Yu for him.
sentences.chinese: 有一個南郭先生，本來不會吹竽，也混在中間湊數。

sentences.english: During the Warring States Period (475-221BC), the King of the State of Qi was very fond of listening to yu ensembles.
sentences.chinese: 戰國時，齊宣王喜歡聽竽，通常是三百人的大合奏。

sentences.english: He managed to join the band, though he was not good at it.
sentences.chinese: 儘管他不擅長吹竽，還是設法混進了樂隊。

definition: ancient unit of volume (half a 合[ge3], equivalent to 50ml)/ancient flute
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
